original:
In relation to COVID-19, Friman et al. investigated the off-target effects of the broad-spectrum antiviral Remdesivir, one of the first drugs to be repurposed for use during the pandemic. Remdesivir was evaluated using thermal proteome profiling in a HepG2 cellular thermal shift assay, alongside the drug hydroxychloroquine, which has been subject to controversy. The study identified TRIP13 as a potential off-target for Remdesivir.


It
